alert.note: Alert for Zapata (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 8:04PM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Jim Hogg, northwestern Brooks and Zapata Counties through 845 PM CDT... At 803 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Escobas, or 8 miles northeast of Bustamante, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Zapata, Hebbronville, Bustamante, Medina, Zapata High School, Randado, Zapata Middle School, South Fork Estates, Siesta Shores and Zapata County Public Library. This includes US Highway 83 between mile markers 754 and 778. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for Deep South Texas.
